fixes.name: Max date Last Year
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR MaxDate = CALCULATE(MAX('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'[Order Date]), ALL('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'))
RETURN DATE(YEAR(MaxDate) - 1, MONTH(MaxDate), DAY(MaxDate))
fixes.solution_explanation: In Tableau [Max Date] is defined as an aggregated LOD ({MAX([Order Date])}). The DAX measure first computes the overall max order date using CALCULATE + ALL to emulate the LOD, stores it in a VAR, and then returns the date one year earlier using DATE(YEAR-1, MONTH, DAY).
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation depends on an aggregated value (Max Date defined as {MAX([Order Date])}), therefore it must be created as a measure.
